element.name: Cause of Injury
element.definition: The category of the reported/suspected external cause of the injury.
element.v3Comment:
Suggested code list is represented in ICD-10-CM: T36.0xx through T65.91x, T71.11x through T71.9 and, V00.0x through Y38.9xx. It is not expected that EMS will utilize the 7th digit, often used to describe the type of encounter (A-Initial Encounter, D-Subsequent Encounter, S-Sequela). Thus, T, V and Y codes should be limited to 5 or 6 digits at the most.
Code list is represented in ICD-10 Codes.
Website - http://uts.nlm.nih.gov
Product - UMLS Metathesaurus

element.name: Mechanism of Injury
element.definition: The mechanism of the event which caused the injury

element.name: Trauma Center Criteria
element.definition: Field Triage Criteria for transport to a trauma center as defined by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention and the American College of Surgeons-Committee on Trauma.
element.v3Comment: CDC Field Triage Decision Scheme - value choices for Steps 1 and 2. For falls, one story is equal to 10 feet.
element.v3Changes:
Added to better evaluate the CDC-ACS 2006 Field Triage Decision Scheme.
Website: http://www.cdc.gov/FieldTriage/

choice.description: Amputation Proximal to Wrist and Ankle
Penetrating Injury to Head, Neck, Torso, and Extremities Proximal to Elbow and Knee
Respiratory Rate <10 or >29 OR (<20 in infant < one year)
Two or More Proximal Long-Bone Fractures

element.name: Vehicular, Pedestrian, or Other Injury Risk Factor
element.definition: The kind of risk factor predictors present at the incident
element.v3Comment: Added additional mechanism or risk indicators based on CDC Field Triage Decision Scheme Steps 3.
element.v3Changes: Added to better evaluate the CDC-ACS Field Triage Guideline.

choice.description: Auto v. Pedestrian/Bicyclist Thrown, Run Over, or > 20 MPH Impact
Fall Adults: > 20 ft. (one story is equal to 10 ft.)
Fall Children: > 10 ft. or 2-3 times the height of the child
Crash Death in Same Passenger Compartment
Crash Ejection (partial or complete) from vehicle
Crash Intrusion: > 12 in. occupant site; > 18 in. any site
Crash Vehicle Telemetry Data (AACN) Consistent with High Risk of Injury

element.name: Main Area of the Vehicle Impacted by the Collision
element.definition: The area or location of initial impact on the vehicle based on 12-point clock diagram.
element.v3Comment:
The front of the vehicle is 12, passenger (right) side is 3, rear is 6, etc.
Based on MMUCC via areas(s) of impact & FARS coding manual clock diagram.

element.name: Location of Patient in Vehicle
element.definition: The seat row location of the vehicle at the time of the crash with the front seat numbered as 1
element.v3Comment: MMUCC P6 data element

choice.description: Passenger in other enclosed passenger or cargo area (non-trailing unit such as a bus, etc.)
Passenger in unenclosed passenger or cargo area (non-trailing unit such as a pickup, etc.)

element.name: Use of Occupant Safety Equipment
element.definition: Safety equipment in use by the patient at the time of the injury
element.v3Comment: MMUCC P7 data element used as baseline information. Data element expanded for added definition in non-vehicular settings.

element.name: Airbag Deployment
element.definition: Indication of Airbag Deployment
element.v3Comment: MMUCC P8 data element used but Other added to include newer airbag devices. URL: http://www.mmucc.us/mmucctraining_old/lessons/occupant/seatingposition_files/seatingposition04.htm

choice.description: Airbag Deployed Other (knee, Air belt, etc.)

element.name: Height of Fall (feet)
element.definition: The distance in feet the patient fell, measured from the lowest point of the patient to the ground
element.v3Comment: Classify same level falls as 0 feet

element.name: OSHA Personal Protective Equipment Used
element.definition: Documentation of the use of OSHA required protective equipment used by the patient at the time of injury.
element.v3Changes: Added to better document personal protection equipment used by the patient associated with an injury.

element.name: ACN System/Company Providing ACN Data
element.definition: The agency providing the Automated Collision Notification (ACN) Data.
element.v3Comment: Based on Vehicular Emergency Data Set: Provider Name. Vehicular Emergency Data Set (VEDS) Recommendations. Version 3.0 Prepared: (February 2011) by the Advanced Automatic Crash Notification (AACN) Joint APCO/NENA Data Standardization Working Group.
element.v3Changes: Added to better incorporate advanced automated collision notification information.

element.name: ACN Incident ID
element.definition: The Automated Collision Notification Incident ID.
element.v3Comment: Based on Vehicular Emergency Data Set: Incident ID. Vehicular Emergency Data Set (VEDS) Recommendations. Version 3.0 Prepared: (February 2011) by the Advanced Automatic Crash Notification (AACN)Joint APCO/NENA Data Standardization Working Group.
element.v3Changes: Added to better incorporate advanced automated collision notification information.

element.name: ACN Call Back Phone Number
element.definition: The Automated Collision Notification Call Back Phone Number (US Only).
element.v3Comment: Based on Vehicular Emergency Data Set: Call Back Number. Vehicular Emergency Data Set (VEDS) Recommendations. Version 3.0 Prepared: (February 2011) by the Advanced Automatic Crash Notification (AACN)Joint APCO/NENA Data Standardization Working Group.
element.v3Changes: Added to better incorporate advanced automated collision notification information.

element.name: Date/Time of ACN Incident
element.definition: The Automated Collision Notification Incident Date and Time.
element.v3Comment:
Based on Vehicular Emergency Data Set: Incident Date and Time. Vehicular Emergency Data Set (VEDS) Recommendations. Version 3.0 Prepared: (February 2011) by the Advanced Automatic Crash Notification (AACN)Joint APCO/NENA Data Standardization Working Group.
DateTime consists of finite-length characters of the form: yyyy '-' mm '-' dd 'T' hh ':' mm ':' ss ('.' s+)? (zzzzzz)
yyyya four-digit numeral that represents the year
'-'separators between parts of the date portion
mma two-digit numeral that represents the month
dda two-digit numeral that represents the day
Tseparator that indicates time-of-day follows
hha two-digit numeral that represents the hour
':'a separator between parts of the time-of-day portion
mma two-digit numeral that represents the minute
ssa two-integer-digit numeral that represents the whole seconds
'.' s+(not required) represents the fractional seconds
zzzzzz(required) represents the timezone (as described below)
Timezones, required, are durations with (integer-valued) hour and minute properties in the form: ('+' | '-') hh ':' mm
hha two-digit numeral (with leading zeros as required) that represents the hours
mma two-digit numeral that represents the minutes
'+'a nonnegative duration
'-'a nonpositive duration
element.v3Changes: Added to better incorporate advanced automated collision notification information.

element.name: ACN Incident Location
element.definition: The Automated Collision Notification GPS Location.
element.v3Comment:
Based on Vehicular Emergency Data Set: Location (combining Latitude and Longitude). Vehicular Emergency Data Set (VEDS) Recommendations. Version 3.0 Prepared: (February 2011) by the Advanced Automatic Crash Notification (AACN)Joint APCO/NENA Data Standardization Working Group. The pattern for GPS location is in the format "latitude,longitude" where:
- latitude has a minimum of -90 and a maximum of 90 with up to 6 decimal places
- longitude has a minimum of -180 and a maximum of 180 with up to 6 decimal places
element.v3Changes: Added to better incorporate advanced automated collision notification information.

element.name: ACN Incident Vehicle Body Type
element.definition: The Automated Collision Notification Vehicle Body Type.
element.v3Comment: Based on Vehicular Emergency Data Set: Body Type. Vehicular Emergency Data Set (VEDS) Recommendations. Version 3.0 Prepared: (February 2011) by the Advanced Automatic Crash Notification (AACN)Joint APCO/NENA Data Standardization Working Group.
element.v3Changes: Added to better incorporate advanced automated collision notification information.

element.name: ACN Incident Vehicle Manufacturer
element.definition: The Automated Collision Notification Vehicle Manufacturer (e.g. General Motors, Ford, BMW).
element.v3Comment: Based on Vehicular Emergency Data Set: Manufacturer. Vehicular Emergency Data Set (VEDS) Recommendations. Version 3.0 Prepared: (February 2011) by the Advanced Automatic Crash Notification (AACN)Joint APCO/NENA Data Standardization Working Group.
element.v3Changes: Added to better incorporate advanced automated collision notification information.

element.name: ACN Incident Vehicle Make
element.definition: The Automated Collision Notification Vehicle Make (e.g. Cadillac, Ford, BMW).
element.v3Comment: Based on Vehicular Emergency Data Set: Make. Vehicular Emergency Data Set (VEDS) Recommendations. Version 3.0 Prepared: (February 2011) by the Advanced Automatic Crash Notification (AACN)Joint APCO/NENA Data Standardization Working Group.
element.v3Changes: Added to better incorporate advanced automated collision notification information.

element.name: ACN Incident Vehicle Model
element.definition: The Automated Collision Notification Vehicle Model (e.g. Escalade, Taurus, X6M).
element.v3Comment: Based on Vehicular Emergency Data Set: Model. Vehicular Emergency Data Set (VEDS) Recommendations. Version 3.0 Prepared: (February 2011) by the Advanced Automatic Crash Notification (AACN)Joint APCO/NENA Data Standardization Working Group.
element.v3Changes: Added to better incorporate advanced automated collision notification information.

element.name: ACN Incident Vehicle Model Year
element.definition: The Automated Collision Notification Vehicle Model Year (e.g. 2010).
element.v3Comment: Based on Vehicular Emergency Data Set: Year. Vehicular Emergency Data Set (VEDS) Recommendations. Version 3.0 Prepared: (February 2011) by the Advanced Automatic Crash Notification (AACN)Joint APCO/NENA Data Standardization Working Group.
element.v3Changes: Added to better incorporate advanced automated collision notification information.

element.name: ACN Incident Multiple Impacts
element.definition: The Automated Collision Notification Indication of Multiple Impacts associated with the collision.
element.v3Comment: Based on Vehicular Emergency Data Set: Multiple Impacts. Vehicular Emergency Data Set (VEDS) Recommendations. Version 3.0 Prepared: (February 2011) by the Advanced Automatic Crash Notification (AACN)Joint APCO/NENA Data Standardization Working Group.
element.v3Changes: Added to better incorporate advanced automated collision notification information.

element.name: ACN Incident Delta Velocity
element.definition: The Automated Collision Notification Delta Velocity (Delta V) force associated with the crash.
element.v3Comment: Based on Vehicular Emergency Data Set: Delta Velocity. The force of impact based on the change in velocity over the duration of the crash pulse. Vehicular Emergency Data Set (VEDS) Recommendations. Version 3.0 Prepared: (February 2011) by the Advanced Automatic Crash Notification (AACN)Joint APCO/NENA Data Standardization Working Group.
element.v3Changes: Added to better incorporate advanced automated collision notification information.

element.name: ACN High Probability of Injury
element.definition: The Automated Collision Notification of the High Probability of Injury.
element.v3Changes: Added to better incorporate advanced automated collision notification information.

element.name: ACN Incident PDOF
element.definition: The Automated Collision Notification Principal Direction of Force (PDOF).
element.v3Comment: Based on Vehicular Emergency Data Set: PDOF. Principal direction of the force of the impact to nearest o'clock reading. Values are 1 through 12 (e.g. 12=Frontal collision, 3=passenger side (right) collision, etc). Vehicular Emergency Data Set (VEDS) Recommendations. Version 3.0 Prepared: (February 2011) by the Advanced Automatic Crash Notification (AACN)Joint APCO/NENA Data Standardization Working Group.
element.v3Changes: Added to better incorporate advanced automated collision notification information.

element.name: ACN Incident Rollover
element.definition: The Automated Collision Notification Indication that the Vehicle Rolled Over.
element.v3Comment: Based on Vehicular Emergency Data Set: Rollover. Indicates if the vehicle rolled over during the collision/event (e.g. True=Rollover, False=No Rollover). Vehicular Emergency Data Set (VEDS) Recommendations. Version 3.0 Prepared: (February 2011) by the Advanced Automatic Crash Notification (AACN)Joint APCO/NENA Data Standardization Working Group.
element.v3Changes: Added to better incorporate advanced automated collision notification information.

element.name: ACN Vehicle Seat Location
element.definition: The Automated Collision Notification Indication of the Occupant(s) Seat Location(s) within the vehicle.
element.v3Comment: Based on Vehicular Emergency Data Set: Seat - Multiple entry for each seats data. Indicates seatbelt and seat sensor data for individual seat position in the vehicle. These elements come from passenger vehicle. Vehicular Emergency Data Set (VEDS) Recommendations. Version 3.0 Prepared: (February 2011) by the Advanced Automatic Crash Notification (AACN)Joint APCO/NENA Data Standardization Working Group.
element.v3Changes: Added to better incorporate advanced automated collision notification information.

element.name: Seat Occupied
element.definition: Indication if seat is occupied based on seat sensor data.
element.v3Comment: Based on Vehicular Emergency Data Set: Occupied - Associated with each seat. Vehicular Emergency Data Set (VEDS) Recommendations. Version 3.0 Prepared: (February 2011) by the Advanced Automatic Crash Notification (AACN)Joint APCO/NENA Data Standardization Working Group.
element.v3Changes: Added to better incorporate advanced automated collision notification information.

element.name: ACN Incident Seatbelt Use
element.definition: The Automated Collision Notification Indication of Seatbelt use by the occupant(s).
element.v3Comment: Based on Vehicular Emergency Data Set: Belt Fastened - Associated with each Seat. Vehicular Emergency Data Set (VEDS) Recommendations. Version 3.0 Prepared: (February 2011) by the Advanced Automatic Crash Notification (AACN)Joint APCO/NENA Data Standardization Working Group.
element.v3Changes: Added to better incorporate advanced automated collision notification information.

element.name: ACN Incident Airbag Deployed
element.definition: The Automated Collision Notification Indication of Airbag Deployment.
element.v3Comment: Based on Vehicular Emergency Data Set: Deployed - Associated with each seat. Indicates if airbag is deployed. Vehicular Emergency Data Set (VEDS) Recommendations. Version 3.0 Prepared: (February 2011) by the Advanced Automatic Crash Notification (AACN)Joint APCO/NENA Data Standardization Working Group.
element.v3Changes: Added to better incorporate advanced automated collision notification information.
